intro: Jamesbrittenia albanensis, commonly known as the Albanian Jamesbrittenia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions of Albania. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
